properties.areaDesc: Port Washington to North Point Light WI; Sheboygan to Port Washington WI; Wind Point WI to Winthrop Harbor IL; North Point Light to Wind Point WI
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 17 at 3:22PM CST until January 17 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, Southeast wind 15 to 25
knots increasing to 30 knots by early evening. Waves building to
4 to 6 feet. For the Gale Warning, southeast winds 20 to 30 kt
with gusts up to 40 kt developing by late evening and waves
building to 8 to 10 feet. For the Heavy Freezing Spray Watch,
heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or greater
possible, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels.

* WHERE...Nearshore areas from Sheboygan to Winthrop Harbor

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until 8 PM CST this
evening. For the Gale Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 3 AM
CST Sunday. For the Heavy Freezing Spray Watch, from Saturday
afternoon through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility. Operating a
vessel in heavy freezing spray is hazardous. Freezing spray may
render mechanical and electronic components inoperative. Ice
accretion on decks and superstructures may result in a
catastrophic loss of stability.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid or mitigate
hazardous accumulation of ice on their vessel.

Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
